member.summary: Return a deep copy of the persistent state, stopping at entities and at collections.

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.UserTypes.TrimString.Replace(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: During merge, replace the existing (target) value in the entity we are merging to with a new (original) value from the detached entity we are merging. For immutable objects, or null values, it is safe to simply return the first parameter. For mutable objects, it is safe to return a copy of the first parameter. For objects with component values, it might make sense to recursively replace component values.
member.param: the value from the detached entity being merged
the value in the managed entity
member.returns: Returns the first parameter because it is inmutable

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.UserTypes.TrimString.Assemble(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Reconstruct an object from the cacheable representation. At the very least this method should perform a deep copy if the type is mutable. (optional operation)
member.param: the owner of the cached object
member.returns: a reconstructed string from the cachable representation

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.UserTypes.TrimString.Disassemble(System.Object)
member.summary: Transform the object into its cacheable representation. At the very least this method should perform a deep copy if the type is mutable. That may not be enough for some implementations, however; for example, associations must be cached as identifier values. (optional operation)

member.summary: Create a new instance of .
member.exception: If equal or less than zero.
member.remarks: If the implements the property is set and the paginator work in "AutoCalcPages mode".

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.Pagination.Paginator`1.#ctor(System.Int32,uNhAddIns.Pagination.IPaginable{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new instance of .
member.param: Enable or disable the "AutoCalcPages mode"; for more detail .
member.exception: If equal or less than zero.

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.Pagination.Paginator`1.#ctor(System.Int32,uNhAddIns.Pagination.IPaginable{`0},uNhAddIns.Pagination.IRowsCounter)
member.summary: Create a new instance of .
member.exception: If equal or less than zero.
member.remarks:
If is null it is simply ignored. If is available the paginator work with "AutoCalcPages mode" enabled.
The Paginator don't make any check about queries. This mean, for example, that the resposablity to check if the query work according the query is by the paginator user. Write your tests to be sure.

member.summary: Get the list of objects of the first page and move the current page.

member.summary: Get the list of objects of the last page and move the current page.

member.summary: Get the list of objects of the previous page and move the current page.

member.summary: Get the list of objects of the current page.
member.exception: When the current page is not available.

member.name: M:uNhAddIns.Pagination.Paginator`1.GotoPageNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Move the current page to a given page number.

member.name: P:uNhAddIns.Pagination.Paginator`1.AutoCalcPages
member.summary: State of "AutoCalcPages mode".
member.remarks:
Default = false. "AutoCalcPages mode" is enabled automatically when a is available. If is null and "AutoCalcPages mode" is enabled the paginator use the to know the amount of availables pages.
Be carefully enabling "AutoCalcPages mode", without a specific , because the first time you try to get or the paginator automatically fecth all entities only to know the value to return.
The best practice is: use the constructor with .

member.remarks: Change PageSize mean reset the .

member.summary: The total rows count.
member.remarks: Return null if rows count is not available.
